channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-9396] date_add()/date_sub() should allow tinyint/smallint/bigint arguments in addition to int
item.description:
hive> select c1, date_add('1985-01-01', c1) from short1;
FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10014]: Line 1:11 Wrong arguments 'c1':  DATE_ADD() only takes INT types as second  argument, got SHORT

We should allow date_add()/date_sub() to take any integral type for the 2nd argument, rather than just int.
item.summary: date_add()/date_sub() should allow tinyint/smallint/bigint arguments in addition to int

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
hi jdere

Are you working on this issue? If not, I'd like to assign it to myself.
Hi spena, I am not working on it, you are free to assign to yourself.

jdere

The Calendar.add() method accepts only INT data types. Smaller data types can be cast. The BITINT (long) data type can be cast only if the value is less than Int.MAX_VALUE.

Is this desired? Do we want to display NULL if a BIGINT value is bigger and it cannot be cast to INT?

Here's the patch that supports tinyint/smallint/int/bigint.

Bigint is supported only if the value is <= to Integer.MAX_VALUE because the Calendar.add() method accepts only integer values.
Oh, hadn't thought about the bigint case .. I would say just remove the bigint handling from the UDF, makes things a bit simpler. They can cast that if they need it.
Here's the patch without support for BITINT data types. TINYINT/SMALLINT/INT are still supported.
